intro: Galium album subsp. amani, commonly known as white bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of East Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, white or pale green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, facilitating its spread in suitable habitats.
